author: jgm
content:
An API question related to the merge: there has been a lot of discussion about the block preparation interface from the consensus layer to the execution layer (`preparePayload`) but nothing that I have seen regarding the trigger condition for a beacon node to send this request.

Intuitively I would think that this requires a new endpoint on the beacon API, where a validator client can tell the beacon node it is expected to propose at a near-future date, and pass along the relevant information (which I think is just the coinbase).  Does this align with others' expectations, and if so should we draft up the API (if it isn't already done)?

author: radekkapka
content: Hey guys, is there any release plan for the APIs? I feel like without an explicit plan there is little chance of keeping all clients in sync. PRs get merged, the Open API page gets updated, but it all happens under the radar. If you decide to bump the version to 2.1.0/2.0.1, then how am I going to find all changes that I have to implement? Can we at least have a `changelog.md` file or a Github release that will list all PRs whose changes should be applied?

author: jgm
content: A changelog would certainly be useful

author: mpetrunic
content: Yes, the next release (minor 2.1.0) is planned after we merge this PR with ssz version headers. Release page is going to contain changelog with links to PRs. Will post it here ðŸ™‚
